attributes.action: Ensure that the BBC are made to give equal air time to football league clubs as they do to the Premiership. My licence costs the same as premiership supporting licence payers, so I should be entitled to the same amount of coverage?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The BBC shows approx, 3 full hours of premiership football, on average, every week, with at least two programmes dedicated to the premiership.
We, the supporters of the football league, who are being starved of television revenue, deserve as much, if not more, than the outrageously rich clubs of the Premiership.
MAN UTD reaped oved £27 million pounds from television sources last season.
This would keep most of league Two clubs afloat for a whole season.
Please help the lower leagues for the sake of the future of English Football!
